Package hr.fer.zemris.java.hw02

Class ComplexNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.hw02.ComplexNumber

  • public class ComplexNumber
extends java.lang.Object
    The class represents an unmodifiable complex number with real and imaginary part. Class offers methods for complex number magnitude, angle calculation as well as methods for adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing, powering and rooting complex numbers ,...
    Author:
    Dorian Ivankovic

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static double EPS
      Used for comparison of complex numbers, first.real - other.real and first.imaginary - other.imaginary must be in range [EPS,-EPS] for the complex numbers to be equal.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ComplexNumber​(double real, double imaginary)
      Constructor of ComplexNumber using values of real and imaginary part of the complex number.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ComplexNumber add​(ComplexNumber c)
      Adds the complex number c to the current complex number and as a result returns the new complex number.
      ComplexNumber div​(ComplexNumber c)
      Divides the current complex number with complex number c.
      boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)  
      static ComplexNumber fromImaginary​(double imaginary)
      Creates a new complex number from its imaginary part.
      static ComplexNumber fromMagnitudeAndAngle​(double magnitude, double angle)
      Creates a new complex number using it's magnitude and angle using formula real = magnitude*cos(angle), imaginary = magnitude*sin(angle)
      static ComplexNumber fromReal​(double real)
      Creates a new complex number from its real part.
      double getAngle​()
      Calculates the angle of the complex number in radians in range [0, 2π] using formula inversetangent(Im(complex number)/Re(complex number)).
      double getImaginary​()
      Returns the imaginary part of the complex number.
      double getMagnitude​()
      Calculates the magnitude of the complex number using formula sqrt(real^2 + imaginary^2).
      double getReal​()
      Returns the real part of the complex number.
      ComplexNumber mul​(ComplexNumber c)
      Multiplies the complex number c with current complex number.
      static ComplexNumber parse​(java.lang.String s)
      Parses a string a creates a new complex number from it.
      ComplexNumber power​(int n)
      Calculates the nth power of current complex number
      ComplexNumber[] root​(int n)
      Calculates the roots of the complex number using de Moivre's formula : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_Moivre%27s_formula
      ComplexNumber sub​(ComplexNumber c)
      Subtracts the complex number c from the current complex number and as a result returns the new complex number.
      java.lang.String toString​()
      Returns a string representation of the current complex number.

        Returns:

        Throws:

        public ComplexNumber div​(ComplexNumber c)

        Returns:

      • root

        public ComplexNumber[] root​(int n)
        Calculates the roots of the complex number using de Moivre's formula : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_Moivre%27s_formula
        Parameters:
        n - - desired root of the current complex number
        Returns:
        arrays of roots of the current complex number, size of n
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n less or equal to 0

      • fromMagnitudeAndAngle

        public static ComplexNumber fromMagnitudeAndAngle​(double magnitude,
                                                  double angle)
        Creates a new complex number using it's magnitude and angle using formula real = magnitude*cos(angle), imaginary = magnitude*sin(angle)
        Parameters:
        magnitude - - magnitude of the new complex number
        angle - - angle of the new complex number
        Returns:
        a new complex number with magnitude and value set to specified values

      • parse

        public static ComplexNumber parse​(java.lang.String s)
        Parses a string a creates a new complex number from it. Valid strings are in format a+bi where a and b are real numbers, e.g. "3.51", "-3.17", "-2.71i", "i", "1", "-2.71-3.15i"
        Parameters:
        s - - string to parse to a complex number
        Returns:
        new complex number parsed from input string s
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if s is null IllegalArgumentException if s is not in the specified format and can't be parsed
